dlgLine.text: This man showed up this morning - he's asked to speak to the leader of our group.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -
- New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Is that the guy?

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Hello, miss!

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: My name is Sgt. Hartz, part of a forward scouting party for the United States Army. Folks, I have good news for you - Uncle Sam is coming to your neck of the woods!

Now, I know you must have a million questions for me, but let me just start by saying that what you people have built here is astounding and if it was up to me, I'd have you all airlifted out tonight.
Unfortunately, that's just not possible right now. But I want to assure you, with your cooperation, I'll do everything I can to make that a priority.

dlgAnsw.text: We've been waiting for a rescue! When can you can get us out?
You're from the military? I thought they were wiped out.
If you're from the military, why are there only a few of you?

dlgLine.text: I want to make it absolutely clear that assisting civilians is our top priority... Unfortunately, our resources are limited right now.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Our forces regrouped out of state several weeks ago. As you may know, we took heavy casualties here in Texas, but our forces to the north have fared much better.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: What we represent is a small part of a much larger force being put together to the north.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: We're a part of the military's newly formed Civil Assesment and Reconnaissance team.
Our job is to seek out survivors and find hospitable locations that will serve as outposts for our forces from the north when they retake this part of the country.
The short of it is, we can't to get to everyone at once, so if you can help us out, I can recommend your school here for priority evac.

dlgAnsw.text: Help you out how?
Bullshit - it's your job to help us!
Not interested.

dlgLine.text: We're scouts and most of our supplies are appropriated as we go.
I imagine you folks have probably gone through hell to keep yourselves fed, but if you could aid us in a resupply, I could definitely persuade my commander that Splendid is a friend to the military.

dlgAnsw.text: What do you need?
Why aren't you using helicopters? Wouldn't that be faster?
I want to talk to your commanding officer.
Sorry, I can't spare any supplies.

dlgLine.text: The military is trying to take back territory as fast as it can. Our resources aren't quite what they once were. Until we've rebuilt our fighting forces, our priority is to aid cooperative regions first.
I'm sorry if that sounds harsh - I don't make the orders. To be honest, we've run into more hostiles than friendlies these days. Your help could go a long way.

dlgAnsw.text: Help you how?
You should be airdropping food for us! I'm not going to help you!

dlgLine.text: Look, I understand - you're skeptical. But I bet a lot of people in there would rather be out of danger. And I've seen some things on the road...
You've adapted - you had to, to survive. But up in the quarrantine zone, it's safe - it's quiet. You'd never know any of this ever happened. I can help get your people in, but I need you to help me.
Sgt. Hartz - if you can excuse us for a second...
<Whispers to you> I think we need to hear him out. A decision like this should involve all of us.

dlgAnsw.text: Help you how?
I'll listen to your terms, but I'm not promising anything.
Sgt. Hartz... you have five minutes to get the fuck out of here.

dlgLine.text: Thank you for hearing me out. Here's our situation...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Whoa there... We don't mean any harm to your group. If you're sure this is how you want to do this, then understand that we will not be back.
If that's what you really want, then you're on your own from now on. There will be no rescue party and no aid coming for any of your people.

dlgAnsw.text: Wait... Okay, let's hear your terms.
You now have four minutes...
Who's going to rescue you from me?

dlgLine.text: Gunner!
<You hear the sound of a jeep-mounted machine gun being readied.> We'll be on our way now... Thank you for your time.

dlgAnsw.text: We don't need you! I'm in charge! This is my fucking state now!
Run, you cowards. Just like last time.

dlgLine.text: <You and Davis watch the soldiers leave.>
I'm not sure people are going to be happy about this... That might have been our only way out. We really should have discussed this as a group.

dlgAnsw.text: They were parasites. Who knows if they would have even kept their side of the bargain.
Good riddance, I say. We'll be fine.
Don't ever question me, Davis. Ever.

dlgLine.text: I'll see if I can get him on the radio - communication has been unreliable for weeks.
CAR Base, this is CAR 8. Do you copy?
<Static>
I repeat, CAR Base, this is CAR 8 - please respond.
<Static>...Car 8.... Go ahead.
We have civilian presence requesting one on one.
<Static>...Negative... Sti... your order... terms... -R Base out.
Sorry about that - like I said, we're lucky if we can get a solid five minutes these days without losing the transmission. But I'm more than happy to lay out our options for you.

dlgAnsw.text: What do you need from us?
I want a solution that guarantees the rescue of these people.
You're squeezing blood from a stone - we have nothing to give you.

dlgLine.text: Due to equipment and fuel shortages, all our birds are grounded except for in emergency situations.

dlgAnsw.text: What do you need from us?
I don't see how we could help. We don't have anything to spare.

dlgLine.text: Well, now hold on - let me explain what we're here for...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I understand. Let me explain...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: We're going to be making a survey of this area over the next few days before we head to our next location. We're hoping you can resupply us on our way back.
You give us about forty rations of food and twenty gallons of fuel and I promise you I will have your people airlifted out of here within a month's time.
I realize that's a big decision to make and that your people are going to need to discuss it. So, we'll be back in a few days, and hopefully we can work something out.

dlgAnsw.text: I'll see what we can do.
Wait - can't you help us defend this place?
I doubt it.

dlgLine.text: Would if I could, but we're a small force and we've got our orders.
Like I said - we can get you out of here, but HQ is going to assign priority to areas that assist military personnel.
Why don't you discuss it - we'll be back in a few days.

dlgAnsw.text: I'll discuss it with my people. No promises.
Wait - can you at least answer some questions before you go?
Don't get your hopes up.

dlgLine.text: Like I said - we can get you out of here, but HQ is going to assign priority to areas that assist military personnel.
Why don't you discuss it - we'll be back in a few days.

dlgAnsw.text: I'll discuss it with my people. No promises.
We have no idea what's going on out there. Can you answer some questions?
You should go.

dlgLine.text: Great... I hope we can help each other out.

dlgAnsw.text: We have no idea what's going on out there. Can you answer some questions?
I'll let you get going.
You should go.

dlgLine.text: I'll answer what I can.

dlgAnsw.text: What's it like in the rest of the country? Is it really safer than Texas?
What happend to the people of this town that went to the shelters?
Why did the military pull out of here and leave us to die?
Is there a cure for bites yet?
That's all I have to ask right now. I'll let you get going.

dlgLine.text: See you all real soon. Take care of yourselves.
Alright, men - let's clear out!

dlgAnsw.text: <The soldiers drive off.>

dlgLine.text: In the quarrantine zone up north, it's like nothing ever happened. We've been recovering, expanding, recruiting... They're doing a great job.
We've got multiple zones all over the country. At the rate our boys are handling things, probably have this country back to normal within a year.

dlgAnsw.text: Another question...
I see... That's all I wanted to know. See you in a few days.

dlgLine.text: I won't lie. Not everyone got out of the shelters alive. For those that did, they're safe and sound in the quarrantine zone. We did what we could, but... those first few weeks hit us all pretty hard.

dlgAnsw.text: Another question...
As I thought. I'll let you get going.

dlgLine.text: It wasn't by choice. Seems most of our forces down here went AWOL. Deserted their posts, killed their commanding officers... It's a damn shame.
We're not proud of how we left things, but that's where the Civil Assesment and Reconnaissance team comes in. We're going to sort this mess out and get people to safety.

dlgAnsw.text: Another question...
I see... That's all I wanted to know. See you in a few days.

dlgLine.text: Not yet... But they're getting real close. Matter of weeks before we have a vaccine. The science types are doing amazing work in the QZ. Probably have it done by the time you get there.

dlgAnsw.text: Another question...
That's fantastic. Well, I should let you get going.

dlgLine.text: We should meet about this immediately.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay. I'll meet you inside.
I'd like to hear some other opinions on this one.
